channel.title: Proper conventions

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Second method looks cleaner. And tabs in notepad etc looks SHIT. Use an IDE that does it properly with auto-indenting.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

I vote for the first method, K&R style (second one) is fugly, it doesn’t keep symmetry, and scopes are harder to spot.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“supamagier, post:24, topic:214276”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=281929.msg2290315#msg2290315 date=1214115780]
Use the second one if you want your code to look good. Use the first if you want to look like you are doing something or you are paid on a line basis.
[/quote]
LOL, I want that job :P[/quote]
Me too. Picked up that gem off “the daily wtf”. Enjoy wasting the next few hours reading the articles.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @supamagier supamagier
item.description:
@supamagier wrote:

Second method, in my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

In the “professional world”, you will use what you are told to use - i.e. your 'shop or projects standard. So it doesn’t matter either way, use the method you prefer on your own projects.

FWIW, I use the first.

EDIT: Oh, and tabs v. spaces:

I agree with Frank_, tabs are annoying. I have my editor set up to replace tabs with spaces, except in html and css files, where they remain tabs to scrounge a few bytes.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

BAsh:

Use the second one if you want your code to look good. Use the first if you want to look like you are doing something or you are paid on a line basis.

Hahaha, I see what you did there.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:16, topic:214276”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=281929.msg2289946#msg2289946 date=1214098722]

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=281929.msg2289941#msg2289941 date=1214098574]

It’s no big deal really. But still I hold my opinion: The second one is better. Also, NEVER EVER USE SPACES. That is super ugly! ALWAYS USE TABS, no matter what you do.

Why would anyone forfeit tabs for spaces?

Edit - frank posted before me, still not understanding why spaces are better than tabs?
[/quote]tab width isnt uniform between applications/operating systems/etc
[/quote]Who cares if the tab is lets say 15px on Windows and 12px on Linux. Still looks better imo.

not pixels, column width, tabs can be 4/8/whatevr, spaces are always 1

at the morons (quest rs, magma828 and pizza pie) just use an editor that isnt a piece of crap, even textpad can replace tabs for spaces[/quote]

morons… morons? When my main question was over the use of braces and not spaces… nice.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

[quote=“pizza pie, post:14, topic:214276”]Well, w/e. I guess the TAB(bar?) is pretty scary if you don’t type too much. Once you take two years of the stupid 6th grade typing crap there is no way you can ever make a mistake in your typing.
And then ofcourse you know the keyboard well so you can easily just stretch your pinky to reach the TAB(bar?).[/quote]

What if someone didnt have a pinky? for space bars you can have 2 hands reach it instead of just your left if they are missing a thumb, they can use another, if they are missing both than move onto index finger and so on… If they have no hands at all, Speech-2-Text ftw

sorry, just being stupid in the text above

but yes not everyone goes through two years of “6th grade typing crap” <- faliure!
most people just learn to type through msn now a days :o that’s how I picked up my keyboard “skills” (yeah right!)

but frank said the first one is c/c++ and the second is java, so were you just telling the difference or saying the first one is wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Well, w/e. I guess the TAB(bar?) is pretty scary if you don’t type too much. Once you take two years of the stupid 6th grade typing crap there is no way you can ever make a mistake in your typing.
And then ofcourse you know the keyboard well so you can easily just stretch your pinky to reach the TAB(bar?).

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @quest_rs quest rs
item.description:
@quest_rs wrote:

or you could keep the spaces copied and just paste them?

I personally use spaces, besides 2 spaces in should do the trick, its not so hard pressing the space bar, just imagine how many spaces you have entered in your posts above, its not so painful once you get into practice, but since I don’t use tabs for my indenting it seems like a nightmare having to use those.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:

item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Spaces are a waste of time. Say you are making a hug for statement, do you really want to have to click space 24 times per line when you can just do 6 tabs?

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

I’m pretty sure it does not matter enough to make a big deal out of, but imo, the first style (using blocks) is a lot better. Not only does it look cleaner to me, but I’m pretty sure that’s how C/CPP programmers block their code according to convention as well (?).

Read full topic

item.title: Proper conventions
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

In my opinion I would use the second one because it saves you a line per brace, because you really don’t want to end up having half of your text file be braces.

Read full topic
